item.description:
This is the fourth session of our HAC group, in which we try to keep track of the multitude of characters and the two main approaches to understanding the contents of the Hebrew bible.

Please read the following sections from our series reference How to Read the Bible: A Guide to Scripture, Then and Now, by James L. Kugel.

  • Chapter 12. Joseph and His Brothers 176-197
  • Chapter 13. Moses in Egypt 198-216
  • Chapter 14. The Exodus 217-232
  • Chapter 15. A Covenant with God 233-249


In addition to discussing the reading materials, we will be watching another 15-minute video segment related to the Exodus and the Bible by noted Egyptologist John Romer.

There will likely be other suggested reading.

Please catch up with the readings from the earlier sessions. You'll get more out of the group if you're aware of Kugel's approach to the source material.

For more information, see http://www.cthumanist...
item.name: Humanist Association of Connecticut Bible Reading Group
